position.marginalia_text: Duodecies Dux Belli fuit, Duodecies victor Bellator[um] Primu[m] Bellu[m] esse. Ha[e]c autem [deleted] Bella, et loca bellor[um] narrat quida[m] historiographus qua[e] tame[n] o[mn]ia loca, n[ost]ra[e] a[e]tati incognita su[n]t. Quod providentia dei factum putamus, ad despectum popularis aur[a]e etc. Henricus Hundingdon liber de Arthuro

marginalia.translation: He was twelve times the victor of warriors in the first wars. But a certain historian tells of the wars, and the places of wars, which are nevertheless all unknown to our age. We believe this to be done by God's providence to the disdain of the ear of the people, etc. Henry of Huntingdon, the book about Arthur.

underline.text: cognato suo, filio Cadoris Ducis Cornubiae
De dubia morte nobilis regis Arthuri
